articles.headline: Inside the Race for the Top Job on Wall Street
articles.snippet: Harvey Schwartz and David Solomon are vying to run Goldman Sachs. One is a smooth-talking D.J. The other is a publicity-shy black belt in karate.
articles.abstract: Harvey Schwartz and David Solomon are vying to run Goldman Sachs. One is a smooth-talking D.J. The other is a publicity-shy black belt in karate.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the early 1980s, Harvey M. Schwartz was working weekends in the cold room of a kosher butcher shop in New Jersey, shaping beef into hamburger patties.

articles.headline: Fighting Gay Rights and Abortion With the First Amendment
articles.snippet: Alliance Defending Freedom has had some notable victories. Now it hopes to persuade the Supreme Court to blunt the sweep of its ruling enshrining same-sex marriage into law.
articles.abstract: Alliance Defending Freedom has had some notable victories. Now it hopes to persuade the Supreme Court to blunt the sweep of its ruling enshrining same-sex marriage into law.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The details were spare when the event appeared this summer on Attorney General Jeff Sessions’s public schedule. He would speak on religious liberty to a group called Alliance Defending Freedom. No exact location was specified. No news media would be allowed in.

articles.headline: Trump Organization Will Exit From Its Struggling SoHo Hotel in New York
articles.snippet: A restaurant has closed and room rates have been slashed at the Trump SoHo, which has had trouble attracting guests. The president’s company has negotiated a departure.
articles.abstract: A restaurant has closed and room rates have been slashed at the Trump SoHo, which has had trouble attracting guests. The president’s company has negotiated a departure.
articles.lead_paragraph: The announcement came on his television show, “The Apprentice.” Donald J. Trump would open his second luxury hotel in New York, a “work of art” in the SoHo neighborhood of Manhattan that would become “an awe-inspiring masterpiece.”
articles.byline: By Ben Protess, Steve Eder and Eric Lipton

articles.headline: Young and in Love … With Lipstick and Eyeliner
articles.snippet: Young shoppers influenced by videos and social media are spending their money on eye shadow and lipstick, and brands like Ulta and Sephora are thriving.
articles.abstract: Young shoppers influenced by videos and social media are spending their money on eye shadow and lipstick, and brands like Ulta and Sephora are thriving.
articles.lead_paragraph: Meghan Roark isn’t too proud to admit she has an addiction. Her habit? Makeup.

articles.headline: ‘Junk’ Mines the Milken Era for Truths That Resonate Now
articles.snippet: Ayad Akhtar’s play portrays the financial excesses of the 1980s — part of what he calls “a collapse of a collective vision” of America — in ways that evoke unsettling new thoughts.
articles.abstract: Ayad Akhtar’s play portrays the financial excesses of the 1980s — part of what he calls “a collapse of a collective vision” of America — in ways that evoke unsettling new thoughts.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Junk,” the riveting reincarnation of the junk bond era now playing at Lincoln Center, “is a fictionalized account suggested by events in the historical public record,” according to an author’s note in the program. “The characters in this play are dramatic concoctions,” it reads, “stitched together — at times — with details pulled from history, but these characters are never anything other than fictions.”

articles.headline: Hopes Dashed, Relatives of Argentine Submarine Crew Turn to Grief and Anger
articles.snippet: Disclosure of an explosion near the San Juan raised fears that its 44-member crew had been lost, though the search continued.
articles.abstract: Disclosure of an explosion near the San Juan raised fears that its 44-member crew had been lost, though the search continued.
articles.lead_paragraph: MAR DEL PLATA, Argentina — For more than a week, as the days passed with little news, relatives of 44 sailors aboard an Argentine Navy submarine that went missing on Nov. 15 hoped for a miracle.
articles.byline: By Daniel Politi and Ernesto Londoño
